Driver Station is throwing these at me
ERROR ﻿﻿ -3 ﻿﻿ CTR: CAN frame not received/too-stale. ﻿﻿ CANCoder 13 GetAbsolutePosition ﻿﻿﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ -3 ﻿﻿ CTR: CAN frame not received/too-stale. ﻿﻿ CANCoder 13 GetAbsolutePosition ﻿﻿﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ -3 ﻿﻿ CTR: CAN frame not received/too-stale. ﻿﻿ CANCoder 11 GetAbsolutePosition ﻿﻿﻿

﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ -3 ﻿﻿ CTR: CAN frame not received/too-stale. ﻿﻿ CANCoder 10 GetAbsolutePosition ﻿﻿﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ERROR ﻿﻿ -3 ﻿﻿ CTR: CAN frame not received/too-stale. ﻿﻿ CANCoder 10 GetAbsolutePosition

and I havent found anything online on what these mean. I used the swerve drive specialties template for mk3 modules.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-01-11T23:25:31.087Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2296,"reads":440,"readers_count":439,"score":11568.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399778,"topic_slug":"ctr-can-frame-not-received-too-stale-cancoder-10-getabsoluteposition","display_username":"Josh Buker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50049,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 4692 | Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctr-can-frame-not-received-too-stale-cancoder-10-getabsoluteposition/399778/1","custom_user_title":"FRC 4692 | Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2989493,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T23:33:11.895Z","cooked":"

Can you check the CAN Utilization % in the Driver Station? If you have a lot of devices, the CAN bus might be filling up–causing messages to be dropped.

I’d make sure that wiring and CAN IDs are ok, but I think that if that was the problem then you would’ve gotten a different error.

I’m not too sure what it all means so I took a snip of the utilization.

can utilization1187×179 33.6 KB

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-01-11T23:42:23.259Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":47,"reads":395,"readers_count":394,"score":314.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399778,"topic_slug":"ctr-can-frame-not-received-too-stale-cancoder-10-getabsoluteposition","display_username":"Josh Buker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/4/a/4adbf2263102fd581423feefe23381466f5cd0d9.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":45763,"username":"Starlight220","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50049,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 4692 | Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctr-can-frame-not-received-too-stale-cancoder-10-getabsoluteposition/399778/3","custom_user_title":"FRC 4692 | Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2989510,"name":"Kim","username":"krf","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/krf/{size}/158158_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T23:48:07.427Z","cooked":"

When you run robot code, it attempts to set up motor controllers and other peripherals using the CAN IDs set up in the code, and by extension also set up on the devices themselves. This error code suggests you have a CANcoder object in use, but there’s no matching device with the same CAN ID or was unable to send out an update in time.

Starlight suggesting you share CAN utilization is a diagnostic tool for that as well. You likely want to use the Phoenix Tuner tool to see what the CAN IDs of the CANcoders on your robot are and that they’re functioning correctly.

When installing the encoders earlier today, we used phoenix tuner to set each id as we installed them and they all blink orange correctly. Also the code creates a shuffleboard display for the angles and such and they all read velocty and angle corectly. I’m gonna try updating the firmware on them cause I cant remember if they ever had that now that im think about it.

Updating firmware seems a sensible thing to do. It’s also possible the status frame timing is configured incorrectly in robot code / isn’t what the robot code is expecting. Are those messages continuously streaming or do they only happen occasionally? During mode transitions / robot startup you can have pauses that produce similar errors sometimes but if they’re sporadic it may not be the end of the world.

Updated the firmware and the stale message is not popping up, it used to send a few hundred a minute. But the thing just twitches. May need to do something with how its controlled because the template uses an xbox controller but with our controller both left and right stick control the motors which only the left should. But the wheels just twitch and spin completely randomly.

No input from the operator and it just will twitch

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2022-01-12T00:04:36.292Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":105.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399778,"topic_slug":"ctr-can-frame-not-received-too-stale-cancoder-10-getabsoluteposition","display_username":"Josh Buker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50049,"username":"CoolBudy1","name":"Josh Buker","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/b3f665/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50049,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 4692 | Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctr-can-frame-not-received-too-stale-cancoder-10-getabsoluteposition/399778/9","custom_user_title":"FRC 4692 | Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2989531,"name":"Kim","username":"krf","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/krf/{size}/158158_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-12T00:08:18.760Z","cooked":"

if the encoders are operating properly now (do they increase positively in Shuffleboard / decrease correctly with their associated movement?) then you may need to tune PID and/or figure out the correct way to translate driver controls into inputs for their template.

You’ll probably want to look at their DefaultDriveCommand.java file in their commands directory to see how they handle translation and rotation at a minimum.

At the moment I am pretty clueless on how this whole program works, so I’ll just try to set the input to what I want, aka 2 seperate joysticks, and then go through everything SDS offers in terms of explanation’s to figure the rest out. Thank you for the help everyone.

UPDATE:

I have swapped everything over to separate joysticks and the controls work just fine, however they wheels will reset to a position near instantly after being moved. Also the shuffleboard values that display current angle will reset to zero after a few seconds even if the wheels do not change direction ( This part is when the robot is not enabled but still on). I was reading some other threads where they mentioned using Phoenix Tuner config to set magoffsets and there is a set to absolute mode that I need to look into. This update is for me to reference but if you guys know anything regarding this that would be extremely helpful.

Can you share your code on github or somewhere so we can see it?

For the most part I am using the Swerve Drive Specialties mk3 template. I have only changed from an xbox control to joysticks, but I will try to get my version posted and shared when I get back in the shop tomorrow morning.

CTRE docs say that the status frame period for the CANCoder Absolute Position calls so without seeing how it’s called in code, I can’t see how it would be stale since you are seeing the CAN id’s set correctly with the tuner.

It would also be helpful to see the output from the self test in Tuner.
